chapter.title: Rack Support
chapter.para: Rack is a specification which describes how web server engines can integrate with additional logic written in Ruby. Rack is a akin to CGI or the Java Servlets Spec in terms of goals and functionality.

TorqueBox current supports general config.ru-based applications. In your application's directory, your Rack application can be booted from a file named config.ru that you provide. The Ruby runtime provided to your application is quite rudimentary. If you desire to use RubyGems or other libraries, it is up to you to require the necessary files (for instance, require 'rubygems').
